<JD_START>
Job Title: Communications Specialist

Location: Waukegan, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Long term ContractREMOTE opportunity

Our client, a large global pharmaceutical company located in the Northern suburbs of Chicago, is seeking a Communications Specialist. This person will be responsible for developing and implementing various communications plans to support multiple projects within the organization.

Responsibilities

Develop and Implement Communication PlansCollaborate with project teams to define the communication objectives and target audience for each project.Develop comprehensive communication plans that include key messages, channels, and timelines.Coordinate with stakeholders to ensure alignment and approval of communication plans.Implement communication strategies through various channels such as email, social media, press releases, and presentations.Write and Edit Content for a variety of communication materials including press releases, blog posts, website content and email newslettersEdit and proofread content to ensure accuracy and readabilityConduct Interviews with project stakeholders to gather insights/success storiesMonitor and Analyze Communication Effectiveness- analyze communication metrics such as open rates, click-thru rates, engagement rates to identify areas of improvementCollaborate with internal and external stakeholders

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Communications, Marketing, or related field.2-3 + years experience working in CommunicationsPortfolio with samples Proven experience in developing and executing effective communication strategies.Excellent writing and editing skills, with a strong command of grammar and spelling.Proficiency in using various communication tools, such as Microsoft Office Suite and content management systems.Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.Attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines.

After you have applied, download our Staffmark Group WorkNOW App to receive real-time job offers and apply for additional opportunities. You can download it from the App Store or get it on Google Play. 

About Digital People

Digital People is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, mental and physical disability, political affiliation, union membership, status as a parent, military or veteran status or other non-merit based factors. We will provide reasonable accommodations throughout the application, interviewing and employment process. If you require a reasonable accommodation, contact us. Digital People is an E-Verify employer. This policy is applicable to all phases of the employment relationship, including hiring, transfers, promotions, training, terminations, working conditions, compensation, benefits, and other terms and conditions of employment.

All employees are directed to familiarize themselves with this policy and to act in accordance with it. All decisions with respect to employment matters and other phases of employer-temporary employee relationships will be in keeping with this policy and in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
